description.en:
Lecturers from the different Chairs will introduce students in their first semester to the research topics that they are working on or have worked on in the near past. Each meeting will be devoted to discussing a text (or more texts) written by the lecturer themselves or by other relevant authors. In 2024/25 the topics will be:
Reading Hannah Arendt in the 21st century (Siobhan Kattago)
Essentialism in the context of biology (Edit Talpsepp)
Are emotions natural kinds? (Bruno Mölder)
George Berkeley on meaning and mystery (Roomet Jakapi)
description.et:
Filosoofia osakonna erinevate õppetoolide esindajad tutvustavad esimese semestri magistrantidele uurimisteemasid, millega nad parajasti töötavad või on töötanud. 
Igal kohtumisel arutatakse üht või mitut vastava õppejõu või teiste sobivate autorite kirjatööd.

objectives.en:
The course has the following goals:
- introduce students to methods and concrete examples of ongoing philosophical research in different areas,
- help students understand what areas or questions they would like to pursue further in their specialisation,
- familiarize with current research directions in the department,
- start developing research skills.
objectives.et:
- Tutvustada magistrantidele tänapäevase filosoofilise uurimistöö meetodeid ja konkreetseid näiteid.
- Aidata üliõpilastel mõista, millistele filosoofia valdkondadele nad sooviksid spetsialiseeruda ning milliste kitsamate küsimustega oma uurimistöös tegeleda.
- Tutvustada TÜ filosoofia osakonnas tehtava teadustöö suundi.
- Alustada uurimistöö oskuste arendamist.

learning_outcomes.en: On the completion of the subject, the student has received an overview of methods and concrete examples of current research in philosophy, has developed research skills, the capacity for academic engagement and cooperation with fellow students and lecturers.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbinud magistrandid omavad ülevaadet tänapäevase filosoofilise uurimistöö meetodeist ja konkreetseist näiteist, on arendanud oma teadusliku uurimistöö oskusi, võimet osaleda akadeemilises diskussioonis ning oskust töötada koos kaastudengite ning õppejõududega.

notes.et:
About using chatbots in this course:
For the tasks of this course, the use of chatbots like ChatGPT is practically pointless. Besides, your first point of contact for any kind of help with writing or understanding a text should be the lecturer: he or she knows more about the subject of the course than ChatGPT. In any case the guidelines of the University must be followed, in particular keep this in mind: "Using an AI chatbot or other AI application to an unjustified extent or without reference constitutes academic fraud". See the full document at https://ut.ee/et/sisu/university-tartu-guidelines-using-ai-chatbots-teaching-and-studies.

grade_preconditions.et:
(1) attendance (every absence needs to be compensated with a short homework, and maximum allowed 3 absences)

(2) active contribution in seminars. You need to thoroughly read the seminar texts BEFORE the seminars, so that in class we can all intelligently discuss them, raise questions, criticize them etc. Failure to contribute in seminars will be noted.

(3) completing assignments every third session - after each block, there will be a week's break when you will submit your assignment in Moodle (instructions to be provided)

resources.mandatory_materials: All the texts to be read for seminars: see Moodle.
resources.recommended_materials: Will be announced by seminar conductors, see Moodle.
